column4: can anyone tell me the terminal command to install the gui login screen for backtrack 4
can someone help me
can someone help me
can someone tell me the command to install the gui login interface for bt4
yes
install a window manager that you like/and a gdm/kdm/xdm that you like.. and we dont support BT here. they have their own channel
i suggest using  'ubuntu' if you are new to linux.
install the proper packages using the package manager tools.
'a program' for a GUI login - would be one of the ?dm login managers. such as gdm, kdm, or xdm or any of the others you can find by using the apt-cache search XXXXX    commands
because sudo wont pop up a gui for the password. use gksudo
and use an  editor that has a X gui   or else launch it in a 'terminal'
You are using a text editor that has an actual X gui?
adding gksudo prompted me for a password, but nothing happened after entering it, so by launch it in a terminal do you mean i have to specify in the launcher that its to open in a terminal?
use a text editor that has an actual X gui like gedit. not vi.
or make the alias run a terminal that runs the commands..   'xterm -e commandtorun'
thank you sir, got it working
depends on the problem
from a termional run 'compiz --replace' and see if any errors are reported.
No errors?  no messages no anything?
So compuiz should be working..  try installing and running the 'ccsm' or 'simple' ccsm tool/gui and enable some effects.
means nothing to me.  You may want to check the forums for the error messages you are getting. could be some odd bug.
